name: Seti Abu Simbel Lake Resort

reviews.text: This was such a nice suprise. Lovely grounds. Beautiful flowers, cottages, and pool area. The weather was too cool to take advantage of the pool and facilities but when it warms up it would be lovely after a days drive or after exploring the site.
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.text: I decided to stay in Abu Simbel overnight so I can attend the Sound and Light show. Many tourist fly or drive in from Aswan and only stay at the Abu Simbel temple site for about two hours. I was very pleased with my overnight stay at the Seti Abu Simbel Lake Resort. The hotel is beautifully landscaped and is along the edge of the lake with breathtaking views. It was a short 15 minute walk on a safe road to the hotel from the temple site. The hotel is near three banks and a little market. The rooms are pleasantly decorated, spacious, comfortable and very clean. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was spacious with great shower/bath. Great water pressure with plenty of hot water. There were many Japanese tourist at the time of my hotel stay. Therefore, the Sound and Light show was done in Japanese. The hotel dinner buffet was excellent and had a variety of meats, vegetables, soups, bread and desserts. The dinner buffet and breakfast was included in the price of my hotel room. The staff were all very professional and polite. I really enjoyed my stay at the Seti Abu Simbel Lake Resort and highly recommend this hotel to others.
reviews.title: Great Hotel Near the Abu Simbel Temples

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Seti resort just adds to the serene aura of this wonder called Abu Simbel. It is located in a near perfect setting with the waters of the Lake Nasser lapping nearby.
reviews.title: Serene - adds to the Abu Simbel aura

reviews.text: The Abu simbel light & sound is one of the best in egypt and staying at this resort makes that dream come true.
reviews.title: ok accomodation don't know what people are moaning about!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: OK if you have to stay in Abu Simbel but in a serious need of a facelift.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anyone who has read my reviews would know I have only ever given one bad one before.
reviews.title: Avoid if possible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well where to start The hotel from the outside was stunning as was the location and the view from our room.The pool was stunning as was the view of Lake Nasser from it .
reviews.title: I'd rather sleep outside!

reviews.text: The room did not lock properly,nor the door to the balcony.The room was dusty and there were hairs on the sheets,in the bath,basin and toilet.There were toiletries provided but they looked as if they'd been topped up from god knows what.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a memorable town

reviews.text: All of us on our tour thought this was a disgusting hotel and we all got bit .Mine ended up getting infected.
reviews.title: A Horrible Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was slow and the staff were not that pleasant,the food wasn't all that great infact given the state of the rooms I hardly ate anything.
reviews.title: A Dream Come True

likes.disliked: — The background music played in the pool, bar and restaurant area (minor detail, but: same song played on loop the whole timein the afternoon; in the evening followed by Christmas carols - in November! - in Egypt!

reviews.title: Paradise .....with a touch of Fawlty Towers
reviews.text: The Abu Seti really was the highlight of our recent trip to Egypt. It is by no means the most luxurious hotel I've stayed at, but will be the hotel I will remember the longest.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are set in little blocks of stone bungalows, covered in bougainvillea and other flowers. Whilst they are probably not up to 4* standard, they are comfortable, with effective air conditioning, flat screen TVs, and perfectly adequate bathrooms. The hotel's location is totally stunning - it is right on the edge of Lake Nasser, in a very secluded spot. The complex is very well maintained, and is the prettiest and most magical place I have ever stayed in, with flowers everywhere. There is a large pool which has a waterfall down to a slightly smaller, deeper pool which is right on the edge of the lake. Both pools are spotlessly clean. There are loads of sunbeds, with towels readily available, and a swim up bar. The staff we came across were all very conscientious and efficient.
reviews.title: peaceful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was only one other couple in the hotel on the day we were there, and they checked out early the following morning, so we had the whole hotel to ourselves, which made it an even more memorable experience.
reviews.title: Beautiful Ghost Town

reviews.text: The price we paid for our rooms included dinner and breakfast; because the hotel was so quiet, a set four course dinner was provided rather than a buffet. Our experience of the restaurant was quite Fawlty Towers-ish. The waiters were rather panicked when we ordered a bottle of wine, and brought out a bottle of every different wine they had, one by one. Our daughter is a vegetarian, which they found very hard to understand. We had a choice of fish or beef for our main course, and thought that they had understood that she didn't eat either - until they brought out our second course - aubergines stuffed with mince! The quality of the food was surprisingly good, but there was so much of it, we could hardly move. The waiters were very worried that we weren't clearing our plates, and we actually ended up stuffing food into my handbag when they weren't looking so that they wouldn't be offended! I ended up crying with laughter.
reviews.title: Absolutely stunning view of Lake Nasser and the desert

likes.liked: — the pool area and the view from the pool

reviews.text: There was a lovely, charming air of innocence about the hotel and staff, and I really wish that we had stayed for another day or two.
reviews.title: Great experience

likes.liked: — Location, staff, overall high quality, good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for one night as part of a tour organised through Kuoni.
reviews.title: Good overnight stop
Seti Magic
reviews.text: If you are travelling by road from Aswan to see the Abu Simbel temples it is advisable to stay overnight and so avoid doing the bumpy 3 to 4 hour journey twice in one day. It also gives the chance to see the impressivesound and light show at night and/or the sunrise in early morning. Do take a torch if you are going to the show at night and wrap up warm - it is cold in the desert at night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a small new town being very slowly developed on the shores of Lake Nasser. Accommodation is in small bungalow style appartments in the pleasant grounds.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text: Rooms were OK with air conditioning. Plumbing and electrics worked OK.
reviews.title: Dirty place and apalling restaurant ..

aka: Seti Abu Simbel Lake Hotel Abu Simbel
